I read an interesting article today regarding that which defines every human being. The article was pretty gritty, and lacked much sensitivity. This is something I can appreciate.

The article basically stated in a nutshell that we are measured by our usefulness to other human beings. Our skills that we provide others. The things that define us, are really that which we provide to others, not to ourselves. If there were no other humans to find what it is you do useful in any way, or to remark on that which you do, it wouldn't mean a whole lot other than potentially your own survival.

The last few days I've been down in the dumps. I wonder if it's actually been the last few days....

Heather says I'm just being too hard on myself. I can understand that the reality is she is trying to make me feel better because she loves me. She only wants the best for me, but has a way of sugar coating the truth sometimes I feel. I wonder if that has rubbed off on me a bit too. I can't fight for very long these days when big issues arise. I just don't have it in me. Acceptance. Conformity.

My health and weight I have realized after years and years (well documented through my journal) of struggling to maintain a consistent healthy figure, directly effect absolutely every. Single. Aspect. Of my life. I mean everything. Most importantly, my confidence and faith in myself seem to be directly governed by my overall health.

The crazy thing is, I used to starve myself when things got a little out of hand. I was a freak about it at one point in time in my very young adult life. I may have mentioned this at some point in the years of sporadic entries, but once I finally lost all that weight in high-school, I watched as the world around me completely shifted it's angle towards me. Since then, I believe this has been embedded into my brain. Life is just...better when you feel good and look good. You take care of you, and the rest takes care of itself. Something Tony Horton basically touches on in one of those workouts. The body will take care of you if you take care of it. He doesn't touch base on how good everything else gets either. It's pretty...spectacular. Hard work will always bear fruit.

Good evening, sporatic documentation that is my adult life. I feel like garbage tonight despite the workout. Yesterday I ate so much crap it's a wonder I'm not sick as a dog. Unfortunately I was not born with much of a gag reflex. I can count on two hands in 27 years how many times I've thrown up. Half of those were probably alcohol induced. Speaking of, I am in the process (again) of toning the drinking and pot smoking down. By that I mean quitting once again. I always end up quitting because my body and mind tell me it's the right thing to do. Sobriety infused with good health and fitness far surpasses any good time I could possible have partying. I do enjoy marijuana tremendously. It humbles me a great deal and provides an alternative perspective on many thoughts. Like so many other things in life, when abused it's no good for you. Start tacking on other luxuries in excess and you've certainly got a recipe that doesn't taste well. I want this to be the last time. I've been in a perpetual cycle for about 7 years now. Constantly making rapid changes to my lifestyle. One minute I'm a fitness junkie that exposes an outgoing, fun and productive personality and the next minute I'm a lazy video-game nerd, absorbing handfuls of local fast food in my own private quarters greasing up my Xbox controllers. That sounds disgusting but it's a sad truth. I'm wasting time. Wasting the fuck out of my time. I'm not getting any younger, and my skills aren't getting much sharper. I was blessed with a lot of different talents I only exploit in small doses. It's beginning to depress me actually, which is not like me. I have noticed in the time periods I discipline my life completely, I am extremely productive and helpful to those around me. I am all around a better person, with the confidence to do anything! As usual, I am able to make these observations as I have done so many times in the past, but what is it going to take to implement it into my EVERYDAY life? I know this world is shit, but I still want to live a long and healthy life. I want to make an impact in this world. If the guy writing on this page 7 years ago could see this post today, he would be incredibly disappointed. Yeah I've got a really great steady job. I make good money and I've got a lot to call my own but fuck it feels so empty. It's literally a BATTLE everyday to not get lost in the day to day routine. It's a BATTLE for me to fight the thought of being there the rest of my life because it's the EASY thing to do. I'm such a fucking sucker for the EASY route. Though I finally did something recently that may forever change the course of this cycle. I tried to get Heather pregnant. Well we tried. It's only a week out but it's the first time I've ever tried to have a child with anyone. Ever since Tara had a miscarriage it's been one of my biggest fears. I remember thinking my entire life crashed down on me and everything I knew was going to change. Ironic....because that's kind of what I want to happen to me right now. After learning of my sister Kayla's pregnancy on Christmas day I realized I DO have the capacity to be a father. A good one at that. I feel like maybe this is what I need to make a permanent change in who I am. I am not banking on this. I gave it a try and if it was meant to be then so be it. The current of this river that is my instincts, guiding my every move, has since come to a slow and steady trickle. I know I'm at the point where hard work and dedication will be my only saving grace. I am living far too comfortable a life right now. Choose Bernard. Two major paths lay in front of you. Your time is running the fuck out.

As a child and teen I was an avid writer in the poetic sense. In my adulthood I believe I have created four works of art through classic poetic writings, all of which were fueled by the notion of loving emotions. Which kind of makes sense, as that's ALL I used to think about growing up.

I don't even know how to explain recent circumstances, but my soul has been touched by a being I had much disdain for initially. I've tried to rationalize this event by blaming these deep feelings on sexual ecstacy. I have come to realize however, the degree of sexual ecstacy I (we) are experiencing can not possibly exist without further interpretation.

I always feel a lack of masculinity when I say this, but to me sex is the ultimate expression of love. While I know this to be true, it certaintly does not mean it always works that way and I am no exception. In fact, I've spent the better part of the last 8-9 years seeking a purely physical sexual lifestyle with women (which I do believe had a lot to do with my own barriers). When you experience the bonding of another soul at a young human age, I don't think you are yet equipped to handle the appreciation for those events responsibly. I believe this to be the reason my barriers fortified in such an intense manner when that bond was severely severed against my will.

Here I am though, almost a decade later without even knowing it was still possible, appreciating this extraordinary experience. I, the bachelor who notoriously preaches the solo journey into adultery and promiscuity, have found myself blind-sided by a soul that has completely laughed at my barriers and warmed my soul with a flame ignition that fickled years ago. I am in awe.

Rightfully, I am now plagued with questions as I have discovered this dormant area of my being once more. My soul has grown substancially in this body in the matters of my life's lessons as I watched intensely behind those barriers. This makes the situation much more intriguing, and different than I remember from the past. I have taken the approach without even thinking too deeply, to simply appreciate these bonding experiences.

I recall becoming lost in a whirlwind of emotions before. My soul ached to swallow the soul of my bonding mate as the experience became so addictive physically and spiritually. I could not appreciate the lessons of bonding at that time, which is something I feel many humans actually rarely do appreciate!

We are here to help one another through life. We produce energies that can assist or derail other beings with our actions. 

This ascension into the bonding of another soul is actually HEALING me as a person I'm realizing. I have become so much less cynical, more appreciative, helpful, & happy simply because of the positive energies given to me by another being. I feel cleansed, and completely exhilerated. I spent a good four to five years verbally stating to people that I genuinely have NO soul whatsoever. My soul felt lost & caged, but I was completely ok with that because at least then the energies of other beings could not harm it. Nothing good, nothing bad entered my internal being. My internal self had become a military camp protecting the most precious of it's cargo through vicious warfare that consisted of not caring about anything, and completely rejecting what other humans had to offer me through any sort of bonding or internal communication.

I am free. I feel free, finally.

This brings me back to the simple act of appreciation. I was so destroyed in the past because I abused and took for granted this bonding experience. Having spent almost a decade numb to the world, as I step out and take my first real breaths from my deepest recesses internally, I can guarentee that I will not make that same mistake again. Maybe there was a reason I spent all that time caged. Maybe it was just my way of dealing with it. Maybe both. Either way, I have emerged wiser, and more fulfilled than ever before.

I extend my eternal gratitude to this soul that despite my INCREDIBLE resistance and rejection, has taught me the true value of love (a couple months ago that word LITERALLY would have made me cringe and gag).

So what did poetry have to do with any of this? As I stated in the first paragraph, the fuel of all those writings were based off an emotion I have rejected for years. I have embraced this emotion, and found it's rightful spot on my internal mantle. For the first time in ages, I feel the need to verse off the top of my head and attempt to create poetic rhythem via text once more.

I don't know what the lyrics are going to consist of yet, but let's call this one:
Reunite (I looked up at my subject line and it felt appropriate)

Lost and hidden the soul divides
A rejection of it's host
A life without, the body hides
The thing that matters most

This is to me, the mystery
How can it not be one?
It is to be, not mine to see
I can't control what's done

So we arrive, the great divide
connects and we are "whole"
Now we contrive and live our lives
adjusting the body and soul

The purpose of which, a constant itch
and answers will never be clear
events are pitched, from ditch to ditch
we rise and fall and fear

Often we choose which side to abuse
the internal or external lust
to light the fuse can be much to lose
you can sever one to dust

Balance is key, when you strive to be
the commander of your fate
Only now do I see, when I used to flee
patience is worth the wait

There is a rhythm to life dont you know
we are pushed in currents and waves
To push and pull aginst the flow
will likely cause you pain

Watch and wait as an open mind
the answers come in time
Just don't seclude that which defines
the bond of human kind

Better than one we are not
the eternal education we face
To humble and hear what we are taught
will only advance our race

I realize now, the reason I write
I have accepted the power of love
It will bond us all and reunite
We can ascend and rise above

Shed these anchors, remove your pride
accept that we're all the SAME!
Be honest inside, we have nothing to hide
and laugh when you have thoughts of shame

There is a final verse I cannot disburse
My final lesson is at hand
Take heed of yourself and lift that curse
the separates your fellow man.

I sit here momentarily, eyes closed, attempting to muster the deepest recess of my soul. That I may somehow put everything into a written text. 

Trying to put the idea of what can only be described as feeling within ourselves into written language, can for some such as myself, be one of the more daunting challenges in life.

For whatever reason, this is something I've always needed to stay connected internally. Writing has this power to almost make it seem as though the words in front of you are not yours to claim. There is this truth that cannot be expressed so directly in any other form. That being said, let us have a moment together old friend.

I don't even know where to begin. What is the area I want to express here? Do I want to reflect on the past events, analyzing where I was and concluding my current state?

You have dwelled on the past long enough.

How could I not though, I'm fascinated constantly of what life is capable of. I can't get enough of it. So many limitless possibilities, yet so structured. Somehow I know that the wall I'm always breaking down is supposed to be there. I needed to be separated. I needed to learn.

Where things will go on the other side is the mystery of all mysteries at this very moment. To learn that weaknesses within yourself can be your greatest strength makes determining what you previously thought was right confusing. I won't lie, I'm disoriented.

As a matter of course I am just following what something in the back of my mind is telling me to, and it's the only path I have right now. While that may seem frustrating having no other options, this path is the most peaceful place I've been to yet. I only have the other beings in my life that care enough to have led me here to thank.

A bow to you all for my eternal gratitude. I only wish I had more to give.

In a more classic journal formula, I am completely back to my nerd roots. Having not a single friend I can count on, I've created the perfect nerd cave/bachelor pad. It's been up for over a week now and I have already found myself wanting more socially in my life.

It completely astounds me how these people are down here. The three I have bent a knee in honor for, have all betrayed me in the most selfish of fashions.
I simply can not put my energy into such fruitless relationships any longer.

I am not inclined to hate, we are all souls of different maturities looking to progress in our own way. Provided these people learn SOMETHING in a life that can enhance the soul in some way, it was a life worth living.

However...IT FUCKING SUCKS BALLS!!!

Ugh.

My sister is the rock in my life. Having been living with her again these last couple months have helped guide me the right way. Lena has always made the righteous choice in life. She's such a powerful human being, I admire her abilities and occasionally envy them. Were she a man, lord knows where she would currently be in life.
She has this ability to express fact so diligently on what IS RIGHT regardless of your feelings. She's brunt, to the point, and says exactly what you need to hear.

My sympathy to cause harm to others prevents me from doing this accurately. Which is why I sometimes envy that trait. In reality it's the right thing to do.

The right thing to do. My current quest and primal focus. This lifestyle leads to a world of loneliness, as I'm just now realizing. I suppose it's how you perceive everything, but most people don't care to do the right thing. You are not likely to be around those people long provided you stick to your guns. 

This is fine, and something I'm prepared to endure. It gives my soul room to breathe, and allows me to feel all the feelings I refused to believe were a part of me.

My father is slipping away. I can feel his energy fading. I don't feel such sadness for the moment as I believe I should. The sadness the future is bringing is not just one of a loss in his physical place on this earth, it is the mountain of potential that man was blessed with he did not capitalize on. It is the fact that his final season of life was spent in such a negative place. Was this life for him to experience such regret? I know he feels it, I see it in his eyes. I see behind the visage that has always been my fathers words. I just don't know what to say or do. He has never been one to listen to reason. A believer of his own words whether or not they may be true.

I want my life to give him as much purpose as anothers life can offer. He is endlessly proud of who I am and what I've done. Constantly being told and hearing the genuine sincerity that my presence makes him feel better. I do not require the same of him, and not having the capacity to reciprocate that I think weighs on my soul just slightly.
 That man was my icon, my life for those few years. He was all the strength I wish I possessed. No fear, always on the offensive, a master in the art of manipulation. A true warrior spirit. He acknowledges duty, and duty only. I believe my father was indeed samurai once upon a time.

I am not my father, though much like him in a lot of physical mannerisms. I accept that now.

I'm not sure what tomorrow holds for me. I'm going to close my eyes and tell myself no matter what it is that does come my way, I'm going to do the right thing.

Until the last page is written. Do the right thing.

Seems like every visit to this old documenting of my life I spend more time wondering how much I've changed than anything else. My last post wasn't even a year ago and I already feel so much more progressed since then. Had I only known the incline I was about to fall into.

 Everything has since been weighed and measured indeed. I now understand how important it is for me to purely focus on my life, though in a sense I always have. I have spent a good deal of time over the years worrying about others. To take a very analytical stand concerning myself, I believe I felt so inadequate about myself and socially in my younger years, that I spent the majority of my young adult life imitating the best parts of everyone else, trying to form this perfect visage. My father hated who I was when I moved in with him, and spent the next 5 years crafting what he wanted "his son" to be. The art of manipulation was most assuredly the best and worst thing he carved into my brain. I attest those years to most of the reasons why I wanted to change who I was. Why I really did hate myself so much, and why I am still dealing with being numb to this day. I surely don't think he meant for that to happen. He never does in any of the negative mental effects he bestows upon his children. He taught me how to deal with life better than most humans, but at a certain cost to myself.

While small battles with myself I still fight, I believe this year I have finally realized what I have been doing for so long. I'm somewhat exhausted, and yearning to move on from it. I expect nothing, I want nothing particularly, and have entered the beginning stages of reaching my zen. For the first time in my life I don't have a clue where I'm headed.

 I am starting to see the cycle of life for what it is, and am saddened. Life truly is a glorious thing for us self-aware species. It is so complex in so many ways that I can never shut my mind off to asking myself questions about it. To say it is anything short of a miracle is arrogance. While the almighty "God", as he has been dubbed in our form of communication, is obviously the most popular version (though these days I suppose that can be debatable) of how all this came to be, I simply can not be sold on what man has made of Him. Religion is a corrupt society. 
It certainly has beneficial qualities there is no doubt about that, however I refuse to believe anything outside of my own instincts. I KNOW there is something else that I cannot prove or see. There is a life force, an energy, that is tangible beyond anything else I know. I will admit however, when I find myself asking myself, or this force questions, I do refer to it as "God". Perhaps my being raised Catholic has something to do with that. Karma is a good example to this energy I believe. Something connects each and every single one of us. That I can feel without question. This energy can certainly, if I had to put a stamp on it, be the God we have fabricated on this earth. That can be said for any of the many super natural fabrications our race has created. 
Philosophy will tell you they all have the same common interests. Those common interests are what EVERY single human being on this earth can feel inside of them as what is right, and what is wrong. We all know the difference, but we choose to ignore these instincts as we see fit. That is selective of course. If what I believe is true though, all those questions concerning how we make decisions, i.e. right and wrong, where are the benefits/consequences? Heaven and hell are obviously what most believe to be the answer to that. I can see why that is easy to believe though. 
Life is all about balance, and the scale has two sides. Everything is pretty much split down the middle as far as right/wrong, good/bad, chaotic/lawful. Which one are you? Well, what if you aren't any of these? Then you go to hell right? Now that doesn't seem fair. Say you spend your life minding your own damn business, not really doing anything good for anyone but yourself, but not harming anyone at all. All the while, not really believing in anything but what you see. That poor person is going to burn in hell for eternity for just living the life he was given? I can't say for sure, but really I think not. The thing about BALANCE is....well...balance. It isn't any one side in general. Some are obviously more inclined to weigh heavier on one side than others. One thing I can say for certain, at least in my life, is that when I feel most at peace, is when I feel balanced. This doesn't mean I do a certain degree of good or bad things to try to feel like I've participated equally on both sides, it just means I understand and accept everything for what it is, and do what my instincts tell me to do.
 If I have to do something that is considered sinful in order to survive, then by...gosh I'm going to do it. Perhaps the balance isn't even a good/bad thing. Perhaps understanding/ignorance is more acceptable. The point is, these decisions we make are for RIGHT NOW. They are for how we feel inside at this very moment. These good things religion teaches us to do are not to be beneficial to us in the afterlife, in my point of view, but to make life better for us to live in AT THIS MOMENT. To be taught to do good things just because you will go to hell if you don't seems like a horrible concept to me. You should do them because it will make life for you and everyone around you better and more enjoyable. This is our one life after all yeah? I'm not sure where I'm going with this or how I got on such a tangent, but regardless I can't help but not feel remorse to the end of the cycle. Although if it truly is a cycle, I suppose there is no end yeah?

I didn't think I'd find myself sitting here looking at this entry box once more. Seems to be a perpetual time-line I can't seem to escape. All things considered, I kind of like it I think. I feel perhaps I just miss writing in general and this seems to be the most logical place to do it for the time being. Eh whichever, I welcome me back. I've been spending the better part of my night attempting to self-motivate this glob of lard I carry around day-to-day. I went jogging after work, figured out a diet plan, went to Wal-Mart and bought some water/propel, and have spent the last half hour looking at some fitness equipment and training gear. I'm aware I'm over sensitive about my weight. Yes I'm ok with that. In fact I don't even see that as a problem. I think too many people are content with their health just because it's easier to do nothing. I remember being in a relationship where I became so comfortable with my life I just didn't care. Sure I gained 25 lbs but what the hell right? I didn't care. Nothing in my life has ever felt like more of an accomplishment then getting as far as I have however. From 300lbs to under 200 (at one point) I have indeed taken strides to better my health. It just feels so damn rewarding and I wish I could motivate others to do what I've done. Especially those who are miserable because of poor health. I do not pity them however, as I'm perfectly aware it's their own faults. I always think I should have stayed in sports. I was made to be an athletic person I think and somewhere along the line I just bitched out. Had my father raised me I would have been an athlete for sure, but I would probably be an asshole as well. Sometimes I like to stand there and stare at my old football trophies from my preteen years. If only my competitive nature had been applied to sports then. That didn't creep up on me until years later. Now everything is a competition. So I'm gonna go to YSU for advertising come January I'm hoping. I'm very anxious to get back in school and apply myself like I know I should have years ago. If there was ever a time not to fuck up, this would be that time. I think this could possibly be the turning point in my life with the way things have been going in every aspect of my life. Work, relationships, friends, and now school. Things have changed quite a bit recently. I think about some of the parties I attended in high-school. Football as a kid. Girlfriends. School. My mother when I idolized her. Digging tunnels in the snow with the neighborhood kids. Playing down the street with Missy and Doodles. Watching saturday morning cartoons with Anna as I held a bowl of cereal in my hands. Where did the time go? Every day goes by faster than the next. Edward Norton was right, we are all dying one second at a time. I took a deep breath and stared at the moon as I unpacked my car tonight. Time just seemed to stop. I felt the air around me and took it in, wind rustling the old tree in my backyard I climbed with my cousins as a child. I sort of watched my life up to that point in that brief moment of peace. I felt really good about being alive and fortunate for what people have done for me. I thought of Katsumoto's statement to Nathan Augrin in The Last Samurai, "Life in every breath." It made sense for once.
